hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Transition via 30-Day Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence > 60%) and its 30-day realized volatility compresses below 40% (annualized) for 5 consecutive days, a subsequent 5% price breakout above the 20-day high will signal a transition to BULL regime with 70% probability over the next 10 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low volatility in neutral regimes often precedes significant directional moves. The 5% breakout threshold filters false signals while capturing early momentum. Current BTC volatility (~45%) is near compression levels.
entry_conditions: BTC 30-day realized volatility < 40% for 5 consecutive days
BTC price breaks above 20-day high by > 5% on daily close

exit_conditions.take_profit: 15% price appreciation from entry OR regime shifts to BULL (confidence > 70%)
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 3% price decline from entry OR volatility expands > 60% without directional move

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout occurs but regime reverts to NEUTRAL within 5 days OR volatility expands without sustained price movement.
